column1: Zelenokumsk (Russian: Зеленоку́мск) is a town and the administrative center of Sovetsky District in Stavropol Krai
column3: located on the Kuma River. Population: 35

column1: It was founded in 1762 as the selo of Vorontsovo-Alexandrovskoye (Воронцово-Александровское). It was granted work settlement status in 1963 and renamed Sovetskoye. It was given its present name when town status was granted to it in 1965.
Within the framework of administrative divisions
column2: Zelenokumsk serves as the administrative center of Sovetsky District. As an administrative division
column5: incorporated within Sovetsky District as the Town of Zelenokumsk. As a municipal division
column6: the Town of Zelenokumsk is incorporated within Sovetsky Municipal District as Zelenokumsk Urban Settlement.
